H0.text: Pollen and eggs are contained in a plant's flower.

H1.text: Bees and blossoms are contained in a plant's flower.

H2.text: Seed and leaves are found in the flower of a plant.

H3.text: Bud and stem are contained in a plant's flower.

A4.text: Pollen grains are produced in the microsporangia in the male cone of a conifer or other gymnosperm or in the anthers of an angiosperm flower.

A5.text: If pollen lands on a compatible pistil or female cone, it germinates, producing a pollen tube that transfers the sperm to the ovule containing the female gametophyte.
